item.title: Streamlined Nextcloud With OpenID Connect Authentication
item.description: This article explains how to set up a fast and efficient Nextcloud as file management tool with OpenID Connect to Authelia. It is part of my series on creating a home server on an old laptop. I’m assuming that you’ve set up Docker, Caddy, and Authelia, as described in the first article of the series.

item.title: Laptop Home Server Build
item.description: A guide to setting up an old laptop as your new home server, powered by Ubuntu, Ansible, and Docker. It securely hosts videos, files, and photos. Add HTTPS everywhere, cloud backup and performance monitoring. Bye Bye Synology, Hello Ubuntu # TL;DR # Synology has a great ecosystem, but one is locked in.

item.title: PowerShell – Batch Convert URLs to PDF
item.description: There are lots and lots of articles on the web describing how to save a whole webpage as PDF. They all use, more or less, the browser’s ability to print to PDF. I needed to convert many URLs at once. Doing that manually for every URL would have been cumbersome, and that’s why I automated the process.

item.title: Running Splunk Saved Searches Powered by Tokens From Lookups
item.description: For a new feature in version 6.0 of uberAgent, we needed to run a few saved searches to do some calculations but let users modify input values. Our requirements in detail: Run saved searches to calculate experience scores for machines, user sessions, and applications Provide defaults for thresholds and weights but let users configure them.

item.title: Introducing vlDeploy - Deploy Applications With PowerShell Remotely
item.description: Managing applications on Windows in enterprises is complex and cumbersome. Admins are using a variety of tools to install, uninstall or reconfigure applications silently. The most popular tool is propably Microsoft’s ConfigMgr. While ConfigMgr (and others) makes sense for mid to large enterprises, the management is too time-consuming for smaller firms.
